title: South Africa: Cosatu North West Calls for an End to Women Abuse At Workplaces On Women's Month
text:
Uganda: Ugandan Women Hail Partial Success Over "Bride Price" System 
COSATU North West on Women's Month still remember how Comrade Pinky Mosiane was brutally raped underground in a mine. 
We must expose all employers who continue to disregard safety for women workers at workplaces. Women with disabilities are exploited and they are not considered for high position in most of the companies including our own government. 
Women at the farms, at the retailers, the resort such as international resort are still being oppressed, exposed to the polygraph test when they are accused of improper acts. 
Majority of poor women workers are still stripped naked by security companies managed by some managers allegedly with racist attitudes. 
We call our government including all employers to make sure laws and policies are strengthened changed in particular on the safety to protect women at the work place in those critical sectors such as mining, farms and hospitality sectors. 
We call on all Trade Unions, civil society, Non-Governmental Organizations and all Mass Democratic Movement structures to take responsibility in making sure that the Sixteen Days of Activism against women abuse and children abuse becomes a continues action for 365 days of the year in improving the conditions of women at the work place. 
All women workers must be protected at all workplaces. South Africa
